I was a middle aged suit. Two years ago I decided to get technical.

I will use this site to document what I am learning and to chronicle the apps I build. The goal is to record what I have learned. If anyone finds this useful or amusing, great. But for now, I am blogging for future me.

Jeckyll, GitHub Pages, and Markdown

This site is built with Jekyll and hosted on GitHub. Jekyll uses Markdown, a text to HTML conversion tool for web writers.

Ruby Learning

def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyllâ€™s GitHub repo.
